title: Don't Criticize, Condemn, or Complain
summary: Avoid criticizing, condemning, or complaining about others to foster positive relationships.

details.content: Criticism and complaints make others defensive and resentful, damaging trust and rapport. People are more likely to change when they feel respected and understood.
Instead of telling a coworker, 'You always mess up the reports,' focus on what went well or ask how you can help improve the process.

content: Pause before reacting to mistakes or frustrations.
Reframe negative thoughts into neutral or positive observations.
Focus on solutions rather than blame.
Acknowledge your own role in situations.

title: Give Honest and Sincere Appreciation
summary: Express genuine appreciation for others' efforts and qualities to motivate and build goodwill.

details.content: People crave appreciation and recognition. Sincere praise encourages positive behavior and strengthens relationships.
Thank a colleague for their hard work on a project, specifically mentioning what you valued about their contribution.

content: Notice and acknowledge others' strengths and efforts.
Be specific in your praise.
Avoid flattery—focus on what you truly appreciate.
Express appreciation promptly.

title: Arouse in the Other Person an Eager Want
summary: Frame your requests and ideas in terms of what others desire, not just your own needs.

details.content: People are motivated by their own interests. Showing how your ideas align with their goals increases cooperation and enthusiasm.
When asking a team to adopt a new process, highlight how it will save them time and make their work easier.

content: Listen to understand others' motivations.
Present benefits from their perspective.
Ask questions to uncover what matters to them.
Connect your goals to their interests.

title: Become Genuinely Interested in Other People
summary: Show authentic curiosity and care for others to build meaningful connections.

details.content: People respond positively to those who show real interest in them, fostering trust and rapport.
Ask a coworker about their weekend plans and listen attentively to their response.

content: Ask open-ended questions about others' lives.
Remember details about their interests.
Follow up on previous conversations.
Show empathy and enthusiasm.

title: Smile
summary: Smile genuinely to create a welcoming and positive atmosphere.

details.content: A smile signals friendliness and openness, making others feel comfortable and valued.
Greet colleagues with a warm smile when you arrive at work.

content: Smile when greeting people, in person or on the phone.
Practice smiling in the mirror to make it feel natural.
Let your smile reflect genuine warmth.
Notice how others respond to your smile.

title: Remember That a Person's Name is to That Person the Sweetest Sound
summary: Use people's names in conversation to show respect and make them feel important.

details.content: A person's name is deeply tied to their identity. Remembering and using it builds rapport and trust.
Begin a conversation by saying, 'Good morning, Sarah,' instead of just 'Good morning.'

content: Make an effort to remember names when introduced.
Use names naturally in conversation.
Write down names and details to help remember.
Apologize and ask again if you forget a name.

title: Be a Good Listener. Encourage Others to Talk About Themselves
summary: Listen attentively and invite others to share about themselves to build trust and understanding.

details.content: People appreciate being heard and understood. Good listening fosters deeper relationships and reveals valuable insights.
During a meeting, ask a team member for their opinion and listen without interrupting.

content: Maintain eye contact and give your full attention.
Ask follow-up questions to show interest.
Avoid interrupting or planning your response while others speak.
Reflect back what you hear to confirm understanding.
